intro: Luzula australasica subsp. dura, commonly known as the hardy woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as grasses, and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant produces slender, cylindrical inflorescences that bear small, spikelet-like flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and forest margins. Its foliage is typically dark green and remains evergreen throughout the year.
